page.title: 03ECOLOGY IN EAKRING
page.content: One of the nicest things about Eakring are the Green Lanes which radiate from and around the village. These came in to existence when Eakring had mills and other villages came via the Green Lanes. They remained because Eakring had an Open Field System until the war and are still used as farm tracks and footpaths. Dukes, Redgate and Pudding Poke woods were declared a Site of Special Scientific Interest, undisturbed since the nodding donkey oil pumps had been installed. The habitat had grown without any outside influence such as herbicides or pesticides. Over 60 different species of birds have been identified of which 50 are known to be breeding, including the nightingale. It is currently planned to create an archaeological nature trail.
